Class ShowroomService

java.lang.Object
com.example.theaterproject.Services.ShowroomService
public class ShowroomService extends Object
Service class for managing showrooms and their screenings in the theater system.

This singleton service maintains an observable list of showrooms and provides methods for managing showroom CRUD operations and screening management. It also handles retrieving all screenings across all showrooms and filtering screenings by movie.

    • createShowroom

      public void createShowroom(String pName, int pCapacity, javafx.collections.ObservableList<Screening> pScreenings)
      Creates and adds a new showroom with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      pName - the name of the showroom
      pCapacity - the seating capacity of the showroom
      pScreenings - the initial list of screenings for the showroom

    • updateShowroom

      public void updateShowroom(Showroom pShowroom, String pName, int pCapacity, javafx.collections.ObservableList<Screening> pScreenings)
      Updates an existing showroom with new details.
      Parameters:
      pShowroom - the showroom to update
      pName - the new name for the showroom
      pCapacity - the new seating capacity for the showroom
      pScreenings - the new list of screenings for the showroom

    • getScreeningFor

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Screening> getScreeningFor(Movie pMovie)
      Retrieves all screenings for a specific movie across all showrooms.

      Filters the complete list of screenings to return only those that match the provided movie by title comparison.

      Parameters:
      pMovie - the movie to filter screenings by
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing all screenings of the specified movie
